Child's pose: Start on your hands and knees with your hands under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. Slowly lower your buttocks toward the floor until your knees are at a 90-degree angle and your buttocks are just off the floor.

Cat-cow: Start on your hands and knees with your hands under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. Slowly round your back like a cat, bringing your chest toward your knees, then flatten your back like a cow, extending your spine toward the ceiling.

Downward-facing dog: Start on your hands and knees with your hands under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. Slowly lift your body up, bringing your buttocks toward the ceiling and your feet toward the floor.

individual_results.prompt: I've been having trouble sleeping and it's been affecting my work. What can I do to improve my sleep? Also, what should I do about these late-night cravings I've been having?
individual_results.response:
Sleep hygiene is important for getting better sleep. Try to go to bed and wake up at the same time every day, even on weekends. Avoid screens for at least an hour before bedtime. Make sure your sleeping environment is dark, quiet, and cool. If you can't fall asleep, try some relaxation exercises or a short walk. If you still can't sleep, consider talking to your doctor about sleep medication.

As for the late-night cravings, try to identify what you're really hungry for. Are you actually hungry, or are you just bored or stressed? If you are hungry, have a small snack that's high in protein and low in sugar. If you're just bored or stressed, try to do something relaxing like reading or listening to music.
